channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14289] Backport HBASE-13965 'Stochastic Load Balancer JMX Metrics' to 0.98
item.description:
The default HBase load balancer (the Stochastic load balancer) is cost function based. The cost function weights are tunable but no visibility into those cost function results is directly provided.

This issue backports HBASE-13965 to 0.98 branch to provide visibility via JMX into each cost function of the stochastic load balancer, as well as the overall cost of the balancing plan.
item.summary: Backport HBASE-13965 'Stochastic Load Balancer JMX Metrics' to 0.98

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1 #1057 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-0.98-on-Hadoop-1.1/1057/)
HBASE-14289 Backport HBASE-13965 'Stochastic Load Balancer JMX Metrics' to 0.98 (tedyu: rev 7a0d36fecfebb1f61811181347f90a9b88a9d09b)

  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/FavoredNodeLoadBalancer.java
  • hbase-hadoop1-compat/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/MetricsStochasticBalancerSourceImpl.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/MetricsBalancer.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/HMaster.java
  • hbase-hadoop2-compat/src/main/resources/META-INF/services/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.balancer.MetricsStochasticBalancerSource
  • hbase-hadoop1-compat/src/main/resources/META-INF/services/org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.balancer.MetricsStochasticBalancerSource
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/BaseLoadBalancer.java
  • hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/StochasticLoadBalancer.java
  • hbase-hadoop-compat/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/master/balancer/MetricsStochasticBalancerSource.java

It turns out this break Phoenix compilation, which implements LoadBalancer.
While we can technically break this, this will be hard to fix for Phoenix folks and keep it all working across multiple versions of Phoenix.

Do we need this in 0.98?

Samarth Jain, Rajeshbabu Chintaguntla, James Taylor, Andrew Purtell, Ted Yu

Reverted.

Let me know the branch of Phoenix you used for compilation.

Thanks for reverting.
And to be clear, we are within "our right" to change this. The interface is marked private. This was against the Phoenix 4.x-HBase-0.98 branch. Mujtaba Chohan has setup a daily build against the tip of the HBase 0.98 branch to find cases like this quickly.
Andrew Purtell's suggestion is to mark this interface as LimitedPrivate. We should discuss. This is pretty low level and we should be able to just change things like this.

For the record I'm uncomfortable with how we've said on this issue we can't make changes to private code because it breaks Phoenix - as evidenced by reverts once we did. I understand being 'good neighbors'. That's fine, and we should do that. However this is a slippery slope. These interfaces are marked private. Phoenix is doing something naughty. Let's get it properly fixed.

For the record I did not make a statement where I specifically say LoadBalancer should be made LP. No worries. I did mention the earlier work making a supportable interface 'Region' out of 'HRegion'. We could do that here.

Thanks for the consideration, guys. Any progress on PHOENIX-1734, Rajeshbabu Chintaguntla, as that will more permanent fix for these types of issues IMHO. Short term, we need to do what Andrew started with PHOENIX-1501.
James Taylor I am working on it. Done with create index,write changes, read changes. Still need to work on drop index and other things.

w.r.t. PHOENIX-1734 , Rajeshbabu Chintaguntla: let me know if I can help in some way.

Thanks
Do we want to proceed here? (And how?) Or just close it.
No updates here for a long time. Closing as Wont Fix.
